scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L is a star with 0.12 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 24722.62 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L system


OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L b

OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2020-06, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 0.63 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L b is 3.975 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L b is 1.820 that of Earth. At 3.975 Earth masses, OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, and a semi-major axis of 0.63 astronomical units, which is outside the habitable zone of OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L, OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L b is likely an icy world.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2018-BLG-0677L - System With 1 Exoplanet
